Reviews.Title: “great value hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ecdias
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Dalla Mora with my daughter, and found it an excellent value. It was clean and in a great area, very close to the train and the bus to the airport, and also to a vaporetto stop. We had a nice (very basic room) with twin beds, and a bathroom. Everything worked as it should, including free wifi. The hosts were nice, and the breakfast (included) was generous.

Reviews.Title: “looking for an Excellent Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pat T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a freind. if you are looking to save money on the hotel to have more money to spend on gondolas and shopping, then this hotel is for you. the price is very reasonable, with varying choices in accomodation. the location is 5 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma where the bus station is and 5 mins walk from train station. it's also just short of 10 minutes from the Pont Rialto or 5 mins from the nearest vaporetto stop. The staff are over freindly if that exists, willing to try and help in every possible to make your stay agreable. the room is very clean and spacious, we had a double room, and the breakfast is simple but very nice and enjoyable. in a quiet area so no noise at all from outside and is located next to a canal. I would definately stay there again should I go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: AustralienSydney
Reviews.Content: I expected this 1-star hotel to be a hovel, but it was in reality a clean, neat establishment with friendly staff. If you are looking for a roof over your head on the island, you can't beat it for value.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate quality/price”
Reviews.Author: Mousiero
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel (that we choose based on Tripadvisorâ€™s reviews) for 5 nights. We had a twin room, with bathroom, in the annex building which is in fact exactly in the front of the hotel entrance. The room was big enough, with plenty of space for the clothes, but basic, donâ€™t expect anything fancy. The bathroom was very nice, with shower and, what is very important, spotless clean. The neighborhood is good, with plenty of places to eat nearby. As Venice is a small town all the attractions are in walking distance. The breakfast included only bread and croissants with jam/honey/chocolate cream or spreading cheese, juice and coffee (tea, etc) and it can be boring to eat the same thing 5 mornings. I would suggest to alternate the cheese with ham or eggs. The 24h wi-fi is a plus, as I noticed that most of the hotels are asking extra fees for the internet connection. I would recommend this hotel as it has a good rate quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “earns its star”
Reviews.Author: Lucy f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a twin room. This is a hotel of good quality, it is not fancy but has everthing you need. Our room was quite small with one wardrobe, a desk and chair and two bedside drawers with plug sockets by them. The smallnes of it was very much compesated by the veranda we could step out of our window on to with a small canal running along side it which had tables and chairs. The bathroom was good, the shower was excellent ,hot and powerful but if your a larger person you might have difficulties as it is quite small. Towels are provided and they have hairdyers to borrow from reception. The radiators are absolutely fantastic. The only downside was the breakfast, it is quite limited. A quiossant and white bread rolls and a selection of jams etc with coffee and unlimited orange juice. It was the same everything morning so if u are allergic to white bread as I am it is really not worth it. The staff are very friendly and helpfull and speak very good English. I would definately stay again when the weather is pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: 2lovethebeach
Reviews.Content: Francesco and Alessandro are the brothers that own this hotel and they are very friendly and helpful. The location within a 5 min walk of the major attractions. The room is slightly small and clean and the breakfast was nice. We would stay here again, the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....”
Reviews.Author: AJHMando
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean. Stayed (solo) in two different rooms at different periods during this trip. Francesco and Alessandro are very friendly and helpful. Very nice small terrace overlooking a secondary canal. Would stay there again and rec to others with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annemarie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two granddaughters in February for 3 nights. The room was a little on the small side but very sufficient and clean The bathroom was a good size. It was in walking distance of all the major attractions and the train station. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We Lucked Out!”
Reviews.Author: shakespeareslave
Reviews.Content: This was the most inexpensive place we could find over new year, and we were surprised that it came with so much romance! Canal views, quiet street, this is definitely a hidden treasure. Breakfast is traditional Italian. Beds so cozy. Rooms were well-heated --a relief to return to after a cold New Year's Eve. Though any Venice lodging can't really offer "value," we would recommend Dalla Mora to anyone looking for a good price. Owners respond to emails quickly and helpfully!

Reviews.Title: “Such a gem”
Reviews.Author: 13inky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009. We had a great little room (shared bathroom) overlooking the canal. I loved our canal view. Ok breakfast, the chance to eat out on the balcony was lovely in the evenings. We also stayed in a 4 star during our stay in another part of the city, but actually enjoyed this place more.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible find”
Reviews.Author: Independent_Granny
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this little hotel. In a great spot and my girlfriend and myself would buy cheese, meats, bread and wine and sit on the steps on the canal and just enjoy the view. Didn't feel like tourists. Wonderful receptionist who lives on Lido and was extremely helpful. This place is an absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: milen13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dalla Mora is a small but very clean and comfortable hotel. It's in a walking distance from the train station and the main attractions of Venice - the Rialto bridge and San Marco square. Francesco, the owner and the person who checked us in, was just great! He answered all our numerous questions patiently and gave us a lot of advice on where to eat or where to go. Our room had a great view to the canal and all night through we could hear the sounds of the lagoon waves and the serenades by the gondoliers - we enjoyed it greatly! By the way, we were warned that water becomes stinky in summer, nothing of that kind! When booking the room, pay attention to the bathroom facilities as some of the rooms have shared bathrooms. The breakfast was not that good but that's all you get in most of the Italian hotels - coffee, bread or croissants with jam/honey/butter - just a small bite before you get out to the city and enjoy yourself in great Italian cafes! Don't miss the chance to taste tiramisou - the special Venetian dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on Island”
Reviews.Author: doopy81
Reviews.Content: We wanted a budget place to stay in while on the island by the canal. This hotel was a real great choice. Easy to find and 10 minutes walk from the train station. Quiet and good location. Checking in was a breeze (hotel was fully booked) and we got a room on the first floor in the building next to the reception area. Our windows overlook a small canal with construction going on opposite during our stay. It was okay as we were out mostly during the day. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. There was a large wash basin, plenty of shelves and cupboards, a large double bed and a stand fan. The shared bathroom was just right outside our room and there were four rooms on our floor. Breakfast in a small breakfast room was rather crowded but food was adequate with a limited selection. The only real setback for us was that there is no air conditioning unit in the room. Also, the Wi-Fi Internet connection was not working in our building then. We had to use the one at the reception area. And the hotel being fully occupied, there is usually a wait to use the shared toilet in the morning. We stayed for 3 days and explored the main island only. We walked everywhere and took the vaporetto once down the grand canal for a short "cruise". It was nicer to get lost in the small lanes by foot and always managing to find our way back to the hotel. And there are plenty of eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great value/great service”
Reviews.Author: sallychicago
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights in late october. for venice this is a great find if you are looking for a budget hotel that is clean and well run. the rooms are simple, the beds were really comfortable though and everything was refurbished and extremely clean. they honoured our reservation which seems to be a big deal for venice, no problems with lost bookings or last minute changes etc. good communication from the owners. the location is great in my opinion, away from the hassle of san marco but walking distance to the all the sights and the more interesting parts of venice. we could sit on the little terrace by the canal where we drank wine after our long walks. the only downside is that there is no a/c which could be a huge deal in the summer and no screens on the windows (mosquito alert). i don't know how that pans out in the hotter months. but all in all, a lovely little budget pension run by caring owners who had the guests interests at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: EdandShelley
Reviews.Content: Venice hotels are terribly expensive, and so it was a relief to find the Hotel Dalla Mora. We stayed at the very end of October and had a comfortable canal view double room with a shared bath, free in-room WiFi, and included continental breakfast for 85E. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. We never had to wait to use the bath. The location was good - a short walk from the train station, although you do have to be prepared to tote your suitcase up and down a couple of the bridges across canals. Hotel Dalla Mora was a good home base that allowed us to use our time effectively to explore Venice on foot. While in Venice, do buy a Vaporetto pass and ride those boats as much as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pennytess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late September. We booked the double room with ensuite overlooking the canal. The bedroom was basic, with a large bed and 2 wardrobes, and the bathroom was small but had everything we needed (including a bidet) - plus clean towels changed daily. There was a hair dryer available in reception and some good guide books to borrow. The great thing about the hotel was the location - about 5-10 minutes walk to Piazzal Roma - where the airport buses pickup/drop off, and equidistant walk to San Marco (about 20 min brisk walk) via either Rialto or the Accademie Bridges. The continental breakfast was adequate and the staff friendly and helpful. A tip - use the mosquito deterrent thingy on the bedroom shelf if you sleep with the window open - it works!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Boston1533
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fabulous find - down a quiet street but so close to train station and some lovely restaurants a stone's throw away. The staff were lovely and made us feel very welcome and the room was simple and very clean. It felt more like we were staying at a friends place than a hotel (which was nice!). Great value for money - would book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Close to station, but close to everything else”
Reviews.Author: aoigirl
Reviews.Content: Venice is small and you can walk everywhere (the only time consuming issue is getting lost... !). Hotel Dalla Mora is very close to the train station and the bus station, and superwalkable to everything else because it's close to the main streets. But it's not in a touristy area which is great. The room I had was very big, in the separate building. I never had to wait for the shower or the toilet. There was a sink in my room. Breakfast was basic, with jam filled croissant, white buns, spreads and coffee. There's a market 5 min away at campo santa margherita where you can get fruit. The staff were friendly and one of the guys had good food recommendations. The wifi is free - the only gripe I had was that the wifi was only available officially from 8 am to 9 pm (sometimes it was on a bit later), which doesn't really help if that's the time when you're out and about and probably out at dinner. Given that most of Europe has unlimited internet (the thing affecting price is the speed of the connection), it would have been nice if they extend that a bit longer so one could get back from the day and plan the next day...

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sixet
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and we wish we could have stayed longer. Ask for the room with a window view on the canal. This is a nice small hotel, with friendy staff and an ideal location. The rooms are clean and reasonably large. The bathroom was recently renovated. From the hotel we could almost walk to the main sites or if needed we just board a vaporetto to reach our destination. Hotels in Venice are quite expensive, but the Hotel Dalla Mora provided a perfect stay at a reasonable price. Would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina1111
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Lonely Planet guide and we really loved it. The rooms and toilets are cozy and very clean. We stayed our first three nights there and we really really loved the bedrooms. It was such a comfortable place to sleep in after our long flight. Staff members are very friendly. Excellent service. We will be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot!”
Reviews.Author: Liliana F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic! We had a room right next to a balcony overviewing the canals. The room was small but very comfortable. Bathroom was very clean. Breakfast was included and of good quality. WiFi in all the hotel. The balcony, again, was excellent. We bought our own bottles of wine, and had them under the moon light! The hotel lent us wine glasses and wine opener!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic price (for Venice)”
Reviews.Author: Swissrmeadventure
Reviews.Content: At 100 EU a night it is one of the cheapest you will find in Venice. Located just an easy 5 minute walk from the main station, Piazza Roma, where all public transport arrives to. Firstly, the area in which the hotel sits is well worth a look. We spent so long around other parts only to discover on the last night that our area was wonderful, full of great places and shops. The hotel is down a side street - but is clearly signed - and consists of two buildings; the left is the check in and breakfast area and some rooms, opposite are more rooms, which is where we were. I asked for a canal facing room - and I got one. Bright, airy, room enough for three, it was basic but clean and tidy with ample storage space - a very decent room. The staff were helpful and spoke great English and the breakfast was basic but absolutely did the job :) It's a very nice stay and is probably one of the best areas to stay in the whole of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, will come again”
Reviews.Author: jaybuckz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before taking the ferry to Greece. Great location, 10 minutes from Pl Roma bus station, and in a quiet part of Venice. Good clean room overlooking the canal. Room has its own sink and shower, have to use shared toilet, but no problems with that.

Reviews.Title: “Only fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ChiLuvsToTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in this hotel after our cruise as our flight was scheduled for the next day. The reason we chose this hotel was because it was very close to Piazzale Roma. Our room was at the building across from the hotel. Very cramped quarters but it was clean. We couldn't even enjoy the small outdoor seating area overlooking the canal as we weren't given a key to get into the main hotel area. The room rate is very reasonable and I would only recommend this hotel if you're only staying overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel we would love to visit again”
Reviews.Author: edjw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed overnight in Venice. This hotel was affordable as well as beautiful! Great location and very friendly service. We shared a bathroom with the other rooms on our floor but I never saw anyone else waiting to use the bathroom. The room and bathroom were nice and clean! We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming location, quiet canal, excellent + friendly service...want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: macha_11
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room w/ 2 twin beds and a great view - Rm. 16, 3rd floor...The hall shower and toilet are great with a window too. Sink in our room. Wi-fi was available. Breakfast was basic.

Reviews.Title: “The best 1 star in Europe!!!”
Reviews.Author: crassell
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at hotel della mora. The room is great, very clean, roomy, light and it had a canal view. The hotel is located within easy walking distance in a quiet area of venice. It is handy to a lot of resturants and the water taxi on the grand canal. The hotel staff were very freindly and helpful. The breakfast was good and freshly brewed every morning. Highly recommend this hotel to people seeking accomdation in venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: chaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Room 15. LOVED IT. We had lovely views of the canal from our 3 windows. It wasa totally clean and bright room. The location is great, near the train station and a lot of cute restaurants.The not so good stuff that turned out to be really minor - there was no ensuite bathroom but the shared (and immaculate) bathroom was literally outside our door. There's also a shower in the room against the wall but who cares. One person can shower in the room while the other showers in the shared bathroom. You save time by getting ready together. Time is $ on vacation! The breakfast was simple, croissants, rolls, oj & coffee but yummy! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily123London
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for 3 nights during the carnival and this little hotel was perfect for us. Central location (10 minutes walk to Rialto bridge), really welcoming and friendly staff, and good value for money. We had a room with a shared bathroom, which worked out really well. The bathroom was very clean and so was the room. The breakfast offered was really lovely too. Absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy07100
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here one night. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. As it was the low season, only one other room was occupied. Francesco was friendly, answered our questions and made suggestions about where to go and what to see. The breakfast was simple...croissants, jam, butter, and coffee, tea or hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Down to earth place, great for budgets”
Reviews.Author: blr5004
Reviews.Content: When I was looking up hotels in Venice I was a little surprised to see how much they were compared to other parts of Italy. After a few days spent searching out the best deals and comparing the various aspects, I chose this place. In the end, I am glad we did. The owner is a really nice guy and is easy to talk to in English. He even let me use a laptop to do some work on. Breakfast was included and convenient to grab before heading out for the day. The room was a good size and had a window overlooking the canal. There was also a super tiny balcony that 1 person could stand on. We requested 2 separate beds but they made a mistake and gave us 1 queen bed; he said he would switch us to room with separate beds after the first night but we did not care so we just kept the queen. We decided to get the room with a shared bathroom and that worked out fine. The bathroom was in the hall and it was always clean. Only once was someone else in there when I was going to shower. The hotel is near the train station which made it easy because we had large backpacks; however, we still got lost. Every time we tried to find the hotel (or any specific part of Venice) we would end up a little lost and had to ask locals for help. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean and comfortable place to fit a budget. If you are like me and just use the hotel to sleep in and spend the day exploring, then this is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpencive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zguchka
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dalla Mora great place for stay. I stayed in single room, it was very little but cozy and very clean room. Behing my window was terrace but in fall time seems there no access to terrace, so i never see someone there. Location is great, i arrive in Venice late rainy night but i found this hotel very easy, there only 5 min from Piazza Rome where arrive my bus from Airport. Breakfast in this hotel really basic, there just coffe, tee and some bread with butter and jam.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sunstarrr
Reviews.Content: Hotel dalla Mora is tucked away in a side street that ends in the canal. It's a great location, 10 mins from the train station and Piazzale Roma (bus station), and 5 mins walk from campo Santa Margherita which is one of my favourite squares in Venice, with its many bars and restaurants (and there's a supermarket there too). It's a slightly less touristy area of the city and quite studenty as it's close to the university. We had a room with a shared bathroom as it was cheaper and we were travelling on a budget. I think this is one of the best budget hotels I've stayed in! We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of September, 83 euro per night for a double room, which is very good value for Venice. Bear in mind that Venice accommodation is expensive so budget in Venice may be more than you might expect elsewhere. We asked for a room with a canal view, and we got it - the room was in the adjacent building next to the hotel, with 3 windows that looked out onto the canal, every day gondolas would go past and we'd get seranaded by gondoliers singing traditional songs. The room was basic but huge, with a table and chairs, handbasin, and a shower; the shared toilet was right next to our room, and always clean. I found it a bit weird as the shower cubicle in our room was right in the middle of the room (!) but as a couple it was fine and it was nice to have a shower in our room - in any case there was a shower in the shared bathroom too. The only bad point was that as the rooms are quite close together and the doors thin, sometimes you can hear other people in the corridor and closing doors, but on the whole I didn't find noise to be a problem. The breakfasts at the hotel were good value as breakfast was included in the room rate, we had tea/coffee, orange juice, and each table is given a basket of bread, pastries and croissants, which was plenty. Staff were very helpful and we could leave our bags at the hotel after check out as our train didn't leave until the evening. If you're looking for a luxury hotel this is NOT the place for you, but as a budget hotel it is excellent and it is very good value for Venice - I'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: STLL78
Reviews.Content: it is very near santa lucia train station and nearer to piazzale roma bus station in venice. quite easy to find this hotel after asking locals for the directions. locals only know the street names but not the name of the hotel. i found it easily the first time. the staff at the hotel was very helpful and friendly. breakfast was simple. i requested for room with canal view and i got one. the room was equipped with air conditioning (which was a plus point in summer). rooms were decent and clean with attached bathroom. the location is less touristy...i liked that cos other parts of venice are so crowded...it is such a relief to stay away from the tourist crowd. i go around venice on the 3 day pass on the vaporetto. it is a great way to go around venice considering the crowd in summer...it is difficult to walk about with so many tourists on the streets in venice...i love the vaporetto which allows me to go whereever i want to with ease...it runs 24 hrs a day. i would stay in this hotel again if i do go back to venice;)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: DitchChich
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews it had received on tripadvisor and comparatively cheap room rates. Our room was right next to the canal, had air conditioning and was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed typical continental breakfasts during our stay. The other hotel guests were courteous and quiet (our room was right next to the lobby). The staff were pleasant and reaily available to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!! Good service !!”
Reviews.Author: sonirohan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent location. Canal view. Loved the talks with the hotel owner. Good pricing. Huge sized room. And also a balcony besides the room over looking the canal. Only thing I disliked - They were not able to keep our luggage after check out as the owner had to go out. So that was a bit of dampener, but rest all was good. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: magioula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dalla Mora for 2 nights. We had the room with a bathroom and a canal view. We thought that the hotel room (albeit basic) was large, had plenty of storage space, quiet, and clean. The location was good, away from the tourists, but tricky to find from the train station. The staff was friendly and the computer in the lobby was an added plus, as we didn't bring our laptop. Venice is expensive, so finding Dalla Mora was a treat! P.S- someone mentioned the kabab place two blocks down (left of the hotel)... inexpensive and delicious! The gyros were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The definition of "basic"”
Reviews.Author: edfromvancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic. Don't take a negative connotation from that but just realize that this ain't anything more than beds, a dresser, a bathroom (clean), and a fan. (No AC, naturally.) I can't believe anyone would use the word "amazing" to fawn over this place. It does the job , however, and the price is okay. Pros: Decent breakfast, decent location. (You will need a map to find it from the train station, even though it's only 10 minutes away.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, canal view-- great for the price in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: NotLostWanderer
Reviews.Content: Comparatively, this hotel is a great value, especially if you get a canal-view room (we had gondolas passing under the window in room #5). The accommodations are basic-- the room, bathroom and shower are small, but clean. The bed is not super-comfortable, but we slept well for a short, two night stay. There is also free Wifi and a computer to use in the reception. Friendly staff, basic Italian breakfast, and the location is convenient-- walking distance (for those with small luggage) from the bus and train stations and in a quieter, less touristy area. Note: While we were there, the building across the canal was being renovated, so there was some construction noise in the late morning, and the view is compromised.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, can sleep here happily, but not for spending time in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Sittinaroundoinuthin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheapish (we paid 100â‚¬) place for a couple in a pretty convenient place, this is fine. Rooms are clean and unspectacular...ours had it's own bathroom/shower which was new/clean. Double bed is two singles pushed together, which is an Italian trait it seems. But what do you want? Place to sleep comfortably that provides bread and jam for breakfast in the middle of Venice? If you want a hotel experience, to lounge around in grand decor...not here. If you want a clean bed and sheets and intend spending your day out enjoying...can't imagine there is better. BTW, the restaurant at the end of the alley where this 'hotel' is...best value place in Venice. Food great, price great, house wine really good/cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sillehh
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel in a quiet side street facing the a small canal. It took us 10 mins with luggage to find the hotel from the bus stop. We got a little mixed up on the way, but accidentally stumbled upon it anyway. Here's how to get there from the bus station (Piazzale Roma): facing east (towards most of Venice), take the walkway in the middle. (You can see a large bridge to your left - don't take that one.) After passing by a few stalls/carts selling souvenirs and food, go over a medium-sized bridge with stairs (there are a lot of these in Venice). After the bridge, continue straight ahead; the sidewalk will curve to the left, and there will be a rose garden to your right and a park to your left. Continue straight over the first bridge over the canal you come to, and you will see the Sofitel hotel to your left. Turn right, and then follow the sidewalk when it turns to the left (don't cross again). After a few hundred feet, you'll see the sign for Hotel Dalla Mora pointing down a small side street. We booked a double room with ensuite bathroom. At the hotel, we met a kind gentleman who spoke good English. We were early (it was around 11 am) and he offered to have the room cleaned and ready in 10 mins! The room was a great surprise. We climbed up 2 flights (he offered to help with luggage but we were ok). The room was large. A big double bed with thin closets on either side. Across from the bed was a large closet containing a double murphy bed. The floor was clean wood and there were many windows facing the canal. The bathroom was small but clean and adequate. The shower only had enough room to stand. A large person might have trouble moving around because it's so small. We didn't see any air conditioning but it was generally cool during our stay. Later in the summer it might be a problem. Having to have windows open means some noise at around 7 AM as the boats come in with merchandise. There was also some construction across the street. Not a problem for us as we woke up early anyways. Breakfast was nice--we got a small carafe of hot coffee and a small carafe of hot milk (you could also get tea). There was also orange juice. Everyone got a basket with 2 croissants and 4 rolls per couple. There was an assortment of jams/jellies/nutella. Also some packaged cookies and toast. I personally missed water but I didn't ask so maybe they could have provided it. I also noted that skim milk is hard to find in Italy. I've gotten so used to skim milk in the US that whole milk tastes weird now. All in all, a great stay on a budget. Clearly, if you can spend more, it would be nice to stay on the grand canal. This hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to a vaporetto stop which was fine for us but may not be the best for everyone. People have mentioned smells in the room, which we did not notice. There were many different smells in Venice itself, one second you'd get a whiff of a tasty meal, the next second a whiff of garbage/sewage and maybe the third a smoker would blow a whiff in your face. Luckily, the breeze is nice, and within the next minute you'd be smelling something good again. A tip for people staying here: for going in the direction of San Marco or the Accademia, it's usually faster to walk west to the San Toma' vaporetto stop, but it is very easy to get lost coming from San Toma'. To get to San Toma', turn right out of the hotel and then right on the larger street (I think it's called Calizada San Pantalon). Take it to the end and turn left - you'll go through a very narrow street and end up at a small canal with a little red fire hydrant at the end. There is a bridge a block to your right; go right and then over the bridge. Then turn right where there is a sign "Al Vaporetto" and you'll end up at San Toma'. One last thing: they had a laptop in the lobby that was free for guests to use, which was nice. They also had free wifi, but the signal was fairly weak and it did not make it to the second floor. It's possible that rooms on the first floor would have signal, but we had to go down to the lobby. Also, when we came back around midnight on a Friday night and wanted to look up our train arrangements, the laptop was gone and the staff said that not only was the laptop not available but the wifi was also "closed." He did not explain why. We thought that was strange, but not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: parsifal18
Reviews.Content: We had the room with bathroom and with a window looking out to the canal and the gondolas going past. Room and bathroom were very clean and breakfast was provided. Location was good - about 10 from train station and about 5 minutes to the bus station (to take the bus to the airport). One thing mentioned previously on TA is the occasional smell... happened sometimes after using the shower or toilet, but went away after around 20 minutes. In all honesty it's a smell that I smelt many times around Venice and not a problem at all. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: maggiemoosmom
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Hotel Dalla Mora in January for a trip my husband and I were planning in May. They were extremely prompt at returning emails and were very accomodating. We booked a room with a canal view that we were very excited about. Two days before we were to arrive we received an email from them saying that their was a problem with our room and we would not be able to stay there, but they had moved us to another hotel for the same cost. I was wary at first because I have read horror stories about this happending to others and they end up in a bad hotel. This was not the case at all - Hotel Dalla Mora personally emailed the other hotel for them to send us a confirmation for our stay and the accomodations they put us in were very nice. Although it was not on a canal and did not have the view I was hoping for, the hotel was closer to all of the attractions and was clean and perfect for what we were looking for. I appreciate very much the level of service that Hotel Dalla Mora provided to us and would book with them again should we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “So there are good-value hotels in Venice, after all”
Reviews.Author: Ranke
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dalla Mora is small "one-star" hotel, modest and simple, but deserves the highest rating anyway - just because its price-to-value ratio (70 euro for a single) comes as such a pleasant surprise in comparison to the rest of Venice. It is located on a quiet alley and a picturesque canal, and walkable from the train station, even with suitcase in tow. Room and (especially) bath were compact in the extreme, and without telephone or television, but recently renovated, clean, and perfectly fine for visiting a place where you won't want to be in a hotel room except to sleep. A small terrace (under reconconstruction when I visited) looks out upon the canal; the friendly, young, English-speaking manager was always available; breakfast is included in the room price (which is not the case in many Venice hotels). Otherwise, I would just second the views of previous reviewers; to whom I am grateful for steering me to such a "find."

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: MikeReality
Reviews.Content: It was our second anniversary and we decided to visit Venice. It was great! Perfect! This Hotel is amazing for it's price! It's very old building, we take most "expensive" room :) With bathroom and WC with canal view. It was my dream to wake up in the morning and look out of window and see the canal. Very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: crucio
Reviews.Content: Funnily, I first heard of this hotel from an episode of the children's show "Postcards from Buster" on PBS and decided to look it up. The room we got was very clean and spacious & overlooked a small canal. We paid the extra 3 euros/night for our own sink & shower (worth it) but opted not to pay for our own toilet. Sharing a toilet was really not a big deal as the shared facilities were also very clean & quiet. Location was a bit of a trek from the train station with our bags (10-15 mins), but it was still worth it to be able to stay on the island rather than in Mestre. Service was excellent and English-speaking. The free breakfast was decent, enough to get you going anyways. For the great price, we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bobbyd737
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of September in a single room for 80 euros per night. It was a bare bones hotel room as expected, but very clean with a good location overlooking the canal. A continental brekfast was included with teh room rate. The room had no air conditioning, but with the windows left open it cooled off reasonably. I was surprised their was no problem with mosquitos - they were everwhere at the airport in Venice, but I didn't notice any in the hotel room or on the Island of Venice. I would recommend to the budget traveler. Nothing fancy, but very clean at a fraction of the price of what most hotels were charging.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BiancaD_9
Reviews.Content: For the 100euros we paid for each of the two night - what value for money! We were right on the canal, our bedroom window literally opened up onto the water! Some people warned us about the smell and we were quite suprised that there was no smell! This little gem of a hotel/pensione also has a roof top terrace that can be used by all staying there. My husband and i enjoyed an afternoon with a bottle of wine, watching the gondola's go by - we were even lucky enough to catch one with a singer on it! The area isnt the best in terms of restaurants, but we felt 100% comfortable and safe here and its literally a 2 minute walk to the bus station (for our trip to the airport) and about 5 minutes from the train station. Keep a map on you AT ALL TIMES! Venice is a tricky place to navigate - we got lost late at night coming back from dinner, in the POURING rain! Arguments aside it was a night we'll always look back and laugh at! Hilarious and lots of fun! Also go lost on the morning just before we were due to catch our flight back home! Missed the first bus - luckily there was one more bus which got us to the airport just in time!! In terms of pricing, Rome was much better value for money - Venice was very pricey for little value.

Reviews.Title: “Canal View Room For 100 Euros!”
Reviews.Author: christina257
Reviews.Content: The highlight of our stay at Hotel Dalla Mora in Venice was the canal view. So cool! The people in gondolas would come by our room and we sat on the bed, drinking wine, and watching them go by. The room we stayed in was a double room with private bath. The room was spacious and had a very cool built-in cabinet system for storing our belongings. The only bummer was the mosquitoes. We stayed in October, so I didnâ€™t anticipate a mosquito problem, but I wound up with around 10 mosquito bites. However, my husband got only one, so this could be a personal issue. In any event, I loved Venice and the hotel was a great place to stay. I only wish the outdoor patio would have stayed open later. I think it closed at 6pm. The breakfast was orange juice, bread, coffee, and orange marmalade croissants. The server was very kind to refill our coffee, which was my favorite part of the breakfast. I donâ€™t know why the same orange marmalade croissants were served the entire time we were there, but I think they should switch it up. Overall, it was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PK0z
Reviews.Content: Friendly and comfortable hotel situated only a hundred metres from the bus/train station (though sits nice and quietly overlooking a typical canal). We had the down stairs room (No. 2 I think) which was directly on the canal and did have its own facilities (which I gather some of the other rooms didn't). We found this hotel excellent, great value and the location made a lot of sense..... why drag bags across the island to your hotel when you can have a short walk to this and then head off to the sights unburdened?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: B3thany
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Venice at the end of a ten day tour for my mums birthday. Venice had always been her dream so I was really dissapointed when I realised I could only afford budget hotel. I shouldn't have worried, the Dalla Mora is a little gem. Its in a lovely quiet area but is still within easy walking distance of the main sites and its throught the walks you discover the hidden beauty spots not in the guide books. We stayed in the annexe next to the main hotel, our room was spotless and had a wonderful view of the canal behind it, we were occasionally treated to the sounds of the gondaliers singing! Breakfast is served in the main building as was a wonderful selection of croissants and pastries, and don't miss having a drink ont he veranda, its lovely sitting there looking out over the canal. If you are looking for budget (at least by Venice standards) accomodation you can't go wrong with the Dalla Mora, I would stay here again over paying more money for somewhere grander, it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM TO RETURN TO AS SOON AS POSSIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Carlaup
Reviews.Content: If you like a good location that is quiet enough without being dull; if you like a place that makes you feel that you don't need super luxury, this is for you. Francesco gave us - a group of friends and some students - the best advice about restaurants and whatever else we needed to know whilse staying here. Being from South Africa, our currency exchange rate limits us when travelling in Europe. Hotel Dalla Mora made us feel comfortable and that we didn't miss anything. The quiet canal on which most of the rooms look, the unpretentious verandah and the relaxed atmoshpere makes up for slightly small rooms, bathrooms and narrow (yet comfortable) beds. We'll be back - even if our exchange rate improves miraculously!

Reviews.Title: “Thank-you Trip Advisor for helping us find this gem in a fantastic quiet neighborhood of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: mbezzina
Reviews.Content: I would normally never make reservations at a one star hotel for fear of it being dirty and located in a "sketchy" part of town. Thanks to the great reviews that I read about Hotel Dalla Mora on Trip Advisor, we booked here and I believe that the hotel and its location is what made Venice the fantastic experience it was for our family. It has one of the few quad rooms available in Venice - at least at a price we could afford. Our room was very simple but the beds were comfortable, the ensuite 4 piece bathroom spotless, and our view of the little canal that the hotel faces was beautiful! It was stifling hot the three days we spent in Venice and our room wasn't air conditioned, but it didn't matter much as the combination of the night time breezes through the huge windows and the fan provided in the room, made sleeping very comfortable. Our host, Francesco was very friendly and helpful. I think what we appreciated most about Hotel Dall Mora was the location. Just 5 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma where we dropped off our rental car, the hotel sits in a very quiet area with few tourists compared to the areas around San Marco Square. The walk and water bus ride to San Marco are both lovely. The first few times we tried to navigate the narrow streets and canal bridges to find San Marco Square we got lost, but that was half the fun. Our favorite piazza was close to the hotel - Campo San Magherita. This was a popular hangout for the locals, especially the younger crowd and there are many cafes that line the square. Our favorite was Pier Dickens Inn - fantastic pizza and pasta at very reasonable prices and a free glass of Persecco (Italian sparkling wine) to start your meal. I highly recommend Hotel Dalla Mora to anyone looking for great value accommodations right in Venice - why stay on the mainland when you can stay right in the heart of this incredible city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nairi2009
Reviews.Content: The first thing I'd like to stress is the helpfulness of the hotel staff/receptionists. Even though we only stayed overnight we met three receptionists and all three of them were helpful, polite, and welcoming. I had an emergency: they responded immediately and were extremely supportive. Even though their English was not perfect the communication happened very naturally. After all why should Italians speak perfect English?! :) Learn some Italian, it's a beautiful language! The hotel was within a 10-minute walk from the train station, easy to find on the map. We were three people in one room, which had a private bathroom. The room was clean and cozy. For an overnight stay you don't need more than a bed. The hotel served a pretty good breakfast. It included croissont, cheese, bread, butter, chocolate, jam, honey, and juice. Definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gem in a quiet part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaAnniero
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel is the hard part (thank goodness for GPS) but after you find it down a lovely little alleyway on the edge of a canal you will be happy you did. We had a very nicely appointed room with a lovely view of the canal below. There were lots of gondolas gliding underneath our window. The breakfast was lovely as well. The best we had in Italy. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone spending anytime in Venice. The price is right and the hotel is a wonderful value stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: MegDav
Reviews.Content: This fabulous little hotel,on the canal,is just great. We stayed for 3 nights and our room was on the ground floor as requested.The fellows manning the reception desk were welcomming,friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean and quite roomy. There was evidence of past floods,but no smell or stains. The bathroom was quite roomy as well and the shower cubicle was almost big enough to bend over and pick up the soap if you had to.Breakfast was adequate and the coffee was real Italian and not that awful American crap that some hotels feel that they have to serve.As a result of heavy rain on our last day, the high water alarm sounded at 11pm and we had to move across the laneway to the annex. However,this was handled extremely well by the receptionist, in the end our room didn't flood and it makes for a great travel story.next time we're in Venice,we'll stay here, the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “They said it couldn't be done!”
Reviews.Author: PukekoPair
Reviews.Content: We invested a great deal of time looking for a place to stay in Venice, determined to find that special place that offered comfortable accommodation, overlooking the canal, with people who cared - on a budget. Our travel agent basically told us that it couldnâ€™t be done. Well it can! Hotel Dalla Mora is nothing flash but it is comfortable and welcoming, convenient to the train station, and our room overlooked a major gondola route. For 100 euro a night we felt like we had million-dollar views. With the windows open we could lay and listen to the bells pealing or sit and enjoy the gondoliers singing as they passed by. The balcony was right next to our room and one evening we enjoyed a lovely dinner of pizza and red wine as the sun set. Booking directly via email was hassle-free. We were given great advice for dinner choices, breakfast early so we could catch our train, and even had our thermos filled with fresh coffee for the journey. For us, Hotel Dalla Mora was absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No: 1”
Reviews.Author: BTLim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at dalla mora on 15 nov 2008 for 3 nites. Although its just a 1 star hotel and the picture shown on the net doesn't looks impressive but its far more better than you think. The hotel is just a 10 minutes walk from train station and we have no problem of locating it. Its of a small alley thats make it very quiet at night. We were placed at the annex just exactly opposite the main building and were given 2 keys, 1 for the main entrance and the other for the room thats make us feel very safe as only the hotel guest have the access to the hotel. Our room comes with a sink which is very handly and the bathroom is just outside the room. This is my first experience of shared bathroom and i was quite sceptical about it but it have change now. The bathroom is very clean and well maintained and although the hotel was fully booked, we have no problem at all using the bathroom. Tha same goes to the room, its clean, tidy and of course , canal view. Its an enjoyment siiting next to the window with a beer overooking the canal. The breakfast is one the best we have in our trip to italy this time. Its consist of freshly brewed coffee, a basket of breads and on buffet table comes with cheese, jams, biscuits and orange juice. Just outside the breakfast room, there is a small lobby area with some latest travelling guidebook thats allowed you to have some reading while having breakfast. This is our first trip to venice and together with this hotel have make our trip here very memorable. The only negative point is dalla mora is quite far from St. mark square, its about 30 minutes walk but even that is an experience. Walking thru the alleys is one of "the must" in venice . I

Reviews.Title: “NIce view out of out window!”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: The map on the hotel's website is very useful, although we struggled to find the hotel from the train station, which was more our fault rather than the map provided!! Once we found the hotel, check in was easy and our room was up on the top floor. We had a view of the canal, which was lovely. The room was small, but comfortable. There was no air-conditioning in the room which was warm in the summer. But the hotel was excellently priced compared to many other hotels in Venice. There was also no tv or phone in the room, but it was fine as we had the whole of Venice outside! We had our own bathroom, which was clean and tidy, whereas some of the other rooms in the hotel share a bathroom. The breakfast included in the price was good and included coffee, tea, croissants, juice, fruit etc. The hotel also had a communal balcony, which was nice. We sat outside one afternoon and took in the views. This also seemed to be a bit of a meeting point with some of the other guests. The staff were quite nice and provided us with directions to a nearby laundry which was very friendly. We were able to walk to St Mark's Square without getting too lost from the hotel. The hotel has a lot of character, is well priced and well located. There are plenty of restaurant choices nearby, as well as the obligatory Venetian gondalas.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly recommend”
Reviews.Author: chelenjeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from October 2-4, 2008 and loved it. It was a quick walk from the train station and was relatively easy to find using the map on the hotels website. We had a room across the alley from the hotels reception on the first floor - it was small and quite limited but all we needed. We had a double bed that was comfortable and clean and we had a bathroom with a shower. Although the bathroom was quite small, it was sufficient for what we needed. We had 2 windows in our bedroom and they opened to the canal outside. Breakfast was typical for the area - some pastries, jam, cheese, crackers, juice and coffee. Nothing to get excited about but it was all we needed. We would definetly recommend this hotel for the price we paid (100 Euro per night)

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: kindredspirits
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there and it was exactly what we were hoping for when we booked. It was full our entire stay, so I recommend booking as far in advance as possible. Our room was on the 2nd floor (3rd really) overlooking the canal with a panoramic view. Very nice. Gondolas pass by frequently. The bed was comfy, not too many frills but it was clean and quiet. Our room was four walls with a shower stall"stuck" installed between the windows, not visually pleasing, but functional. Just outside the door was a shared bathroom with another shower and a toilet. We were busy enjoying Venice, so we were in the room very little and had no prob with the arrangement. From the train station, if you do it right, you will only cross over 1 bridge with your luggage. You'll also go up and down the steps of another bridge, but won't cross it. Great location. It's in an area that we would not have explored otherwise, not too touristy, near the Friari Church. It is about 15 minutes to Rialto, but we rarely made it straight there without stopping for pics, pastry's or coffee along the way. It's about the same distance to the Accademia Bridge. Without hesitation, we would stay there again when visiting Venice. Great value, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzwestie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from overseas and one of our stays was Hotel Dalla Mora in Venice. We loved it. Very clean. Big double bed for myself and husband and a bunk bed for our daughter. Shared bathroom facilities which we never saw anyone else use. Sink in our room Big windows opening out to a courtyard. The location of this Hotel was perfect. The price even better. Breakfast in the morning was just what we needed. Definitely recommend this to all. Jacquie

Reviews.Title: “Great Quad Room in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Toomanycarryons
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 school-aged children, and needed an affordable quad room in Venice! The Dalla Mora was SUCH a wonderful surprise! A large room with bunk beds for the kids and plenty of room to feel at home. Private bath was sparkling clean! We had 3 windows that looked out onto a quiet canal that gondoliers frequent. There is a "help yourself" shelf of guidebooks in the lobby that helped us plan our days, and even some of the rest of our trip! The terrace was a great place for lunch, or late night drinks. I would definately stay there again, and recommend it for anyone not requiring luxury accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LianOntario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. All staffs are very nice and super helpful. They tried their best to make us happy and comfortable. I really didn't feel that I stayed in a 1 star hotel. I would highly recommended this hotel to other ppl. Our room with a canal view and private bathroom is really nice. It's clean and big, and the canal view is excellent. The location is good and perfect to us (easy to walk everywhere and it's near the Piazzale Roma bus station). We are very very happy with our stay in this hotel ^^

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet amid the crowds”
Reviews.Author: phillykat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in April with my 17 year old daughter. The hotel is in an excellent location, less busy and congested than the Piazza San Marco area, but easy to walk everywhere. Plus, easy to get to from the Piazzale Roma bus terminal or the S. Lucia train station. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, stores and the Campo Santa Margherita nearby. Our room was in the annex building, overlooking the canal. The bath was supposedly shared, but we were the only ones using it, so it was no problem. The room was plain and simple, but totally clean and comfortable. I wouldn't select a room or hotel in Venice based on its fabulousness because, unless the weather is terrible, you're out exploring the whole time any way. The staff were charming and gracious and very patient with my halting Italian, even though their English is much better. Breakfast consists of coffee, bread, and a few other items, but was perfectly adequate and fresh. You can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Eaze
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Dalla Mora, and I was very happy with my experience. This hotel could be in a dictionary, as an example for value for money! Originally I had booked a single room w/ bath but I arrived a night early and was treated to a double, with a view over the canal, a great bathroom and a very comfy bed. So I was worried that the single would be a let down. It wasnÂ´t! Sure it was small, but it was perfect for my needs. It opens up to the lovely roof terrace, so I am not sure how it would feel during the summer, when there might be people using it, sitting there, but in April the terrace was closed, so it felt like I had a huge balcony, all to myself! The location is excellent, just three bridges from the bus-terminal, one more from the train, so the luggage lugging was cut to a minimum. The breakfast is simple, but sufficient, and the front desk staff friendly and helpful. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends, and will make sure to stay there again if I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: vacations99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of November, 2007, a quiet time for Venice. The hotel is simple, clean, with friendly owners. Delightful, simple complementary breakfast. A great budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNik
Reviews.Content: We had a short (2 nights) but excellent stay here - the price is ridiculously good for Venice standards - we got room 5 - a double room with private ensuite, overlooking the canal, for 95 euros/night including breakfast. The room was clean, had 'Ikea' type furniture, but it was view that took our breath away! Open up the windows, look down onto the canal, and enjoy! The best time is around sunset, when tour groups of gondolas pass by, and one of the gondolas will have a singer and accordian player - enjoy the free concert! The location is very convenient if coming from the train station, only a 10-15 minute walk away. You can get the traghetto (standing public gondola) across the Grand Canal, and then continue walking across to St Marks Square. We can recommend the "secret itineries tour" at the Palazzo Ducale - definitely worth doing! Also, you can book a timeslot for St Marks Basilica on the internet (free), which enables you to skip the long line.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dalla Mora
HotelInfo.Address: Salizada San Pantalon, 30135 Venice, Italy
